alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 5:06PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Imperial and Riverside Counties through 545 PM PDT... At 506 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Nicholls Warm Springs, or 29 miles east of Desert Center, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blythe. This includes CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 115 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Palo Verde Valley
